excerpt: Puno is a city in southern Peru on Lake Titicaca, one of South America's largest lakes and the world's highest navigable body of water. A regional trading hub, the city's also considered Peru's "folkloric capital," owing to its traditional festivals featuring vibrant music and dancing. Landmarks include the Andean baroque-style Puno Cathedral and the Yavari, a 19th-century steamship (now a bed and breakfast).
detail_description: Puno, located in southern Peru on the shores of Lake Titicaca, is known for being a regional trading center and the 'folkloric capital' of Peru due to its lively traditional festivals. The city boasts landmarks such as the Andean baroque-style Puno Cathedral and the Yavari, a 19th-century steamship turned bed and breakfast.
name: Puno

detail_description: Cafe Bar de la Casa del Corregidor is a cozy cafe located in the heart of Puno, offering a warm atmosphere and a variety of dining options. The menu features Peruvian cuisine, including gluten-free and vegetarian choices. Guests can enjoy Coffee Tunki, recognized as one of the best organic gourmet coffees in South America. In addition to serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner, the cafe also provides cultural activities and information about rural tourism.
name: Cafe Bar de la Casa del Corregidor

excerpt: Baroque-style Catholic church dating to the 1700s, with a stone facade & tours available.
detail_description: Puno Cathedral, a Baroque-style Catholic church constructed in 1757 by Simon de Asto, is a significant landmark located near the main square (Plaza de Armas) of Puno. The cathedral's stone facade showcases impressive architecture from the colonial era. According to local history, the area where the cathedral stands was once submerged under water from Lake Titicaca during flooding.
name: Puno Cathedral

excerpt: Museum featuring paintings by Carlos Dreyer, as well as Incan & colonial artifacts & art.
detail_description: The Museo Carlos Dreyer is a small museum located near Casa del Corregidor in Puno. Founded by the German painter Carlos Dreyer, it features an eclectic collection of art and archaeological relics from various historical periods including pre-Inca, Inca, Colonial, and Republic. The museum houses paintings by Carlos Dreyer as well as a variety of artifacts such as jewelry, ceramics, textiles, and lithic pieces from the pre-Hispanic era.
name: Museo Carlos Dreyer

excerpt: Square flanked by colonial-era houses & Puno Cathedral, with grassy areas, flower beds & benches.
detail_description: Plaza Mayor de Puno, also known as Plaza de Armas, is a historic square surrounded by colonial buildings and the impressive Puno Cathedral. Visitors can take a leisurely stroll along Jiron Lima, lined with cafes and restaurants, and admire the oldest house in Puno, La Casa del Corregidor. The square also offers green spaces, flower beds, and benches for relaxation.
name: Plaza Mayor de Puno

excerpt: 19th-century British gunship offering tours, a close-up look at the engine & simple B&B lodging.
detail_description: Yavari is a 19th-century British gunship that now offers tours, providing visitors with the opportunity to get an up-close look at its engine and offering simple B&B lodging. The experience includes round trip private tourist transportation, an English-Spanish speaking guide for the day, entrance fees to Dreyer Museum and donations for Yavari Steam Ship.
name: Yavari

detail_description: Los Uros, also known as the Floating Islands in Puno, Peru, are a must-see attraction for tourists. These original and authentic floating islands have garnered popularity due to their unique nature. Despite the tourist influx, visiting Los Uros is still worthwhile to witness the incredible construction of these islands made entirely of reeds and learn about how the Uros people sustain their lives on these tiny buoyant platforms in the middle of Lake Titicaca.
name: Los Uros
address: Lago Titicaca, Hotel Libertador, Isla Esteves s/n, Puno, Peru

detail_description: When traveling to Copacabana from Puno, it's important to have cash on hand as there are no ATMs in the vicinity of the immigration checkpoint. Be sure to plan ahead and bring enough local currency for your journey.
name: Copacabana
Cerrito Huajsapata
address: 5X59+G5R, Acceso al Cerro Huajsapata, Puno 21001, Peru

detail_description: Nestled within the charming La Casona Parodi, Tulipans Restaurant offers a delightful culinary experience in Puno. This beloved eatery is renowned for its diverse menu that beautifully blends international flavors with local Peruvian ingredients. Guests can savor an array of dishes, including mouthwatering pizzas baked in a traditional stone oven, which impart a unique smoky flavor and crispy texture. With options ranging from fresh vegetables to hearty meats, there's something to satisfy every palate.
name: Tulipans Restaurant

detail_description: Cochera Lampa is a charming town in Puno, known for its traditional dances, stunning lakes, and picturesque landscapes. It's conveniently located for visiting nearby attractions like the town of Azangar with its hidden temple treasures. Make sure to include Cochera Lampa in your travel itinerary to experience the rich cultural heritage and natural beauty of the region.
name: Cochera Lampa

excerpt: Landmark stone archway built as a tribute to those who fought in historic battles.
detail_description: Arco Deustua is a stunning stone archway that stands as a tribute to the brave Peruvians who fought valiantly in the historic battles of Junin and Ayacucho. Nestled just three blocks from Puno's bustling main street, this monument not only serves as a significant historical landmark but also offers picturesque views for visitors.
name: Arco Deustua

detail_description: Alma Bar Restaurante, located within the charming Casa Andina Premium hotel in Puno, Peru, offers a high-quality culinary experience set against the backdrop of a historic monument. The menu features a diverse selection of dishes that creatively blend local ingredients with international flavors and put a modern twist on traditional Peruvian recipes. From stuffed red peppers to alpaca steak, the restaurant's offerings cater to various dietary preferences including vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free options.
name: Alma Bar Restaurante

detail_description: Mojsa Restaurant, located in Peru, has been a beloved dining spot for both locals and tourists for over three decades. The restaurant is known for its traditional Piura cuisine, with a specialty in black shell ceviche that showcases the region's marine flavors. Housed in a charming colonial building, Mojsa offers intimate balcony seating overlooking Plaza de Armas as well as lively interior rooms. The menu features reasonably priced Novo Andino cuisine with a fusion of traditional and criollo flavors.
name: Mojsa Restaurant

detail_description: Sushi Ten Bento is a renowned Japanese restaurant located in Puno, Peru, offering a delectable selection of sushi and Bento options featuring ecologically clean trout and fresh vegetables. Their menu boasts a variety of Japanese dishes, catering to vegetarians and vegans as well as offering Asian and international cuisine. This establishment is highly regarded for its exceptional sushi prepared with locally sourced ingredients. Visitors praise the friendly English-speaking staff, reasonable prices, and the overall dining experience.
name: Sushi Ten Bento | Auténtico Restaurante Japonés

detail_description: Every February, the vibrant and captivating Virgen de la Candelaria festival unfolds in Puno. This spectacular event showcases a mesmerizing display of over 100,000 dancers and 40,000 musicians adorned in intricate and colorful costumes that often weigh up to 60 lbs. The elaborate outfits can take months to craft, adding an extra layer of artistry to the festivities.
name: Virgen De La Candelaria

excerpt: Benches & shrubbery encircle this small, church-facing park with a central monument.
detail_description: Pino Park, situated in the heart of Puno, is a charming small park adorned with benches and greenery, featuring a central monument dedicated to Dr. Manuel Pino, a war hero. Adjacent to the park is JR Lima, the main street of Puno, lined with captivating sculptures depicting regional dances and offering various amenities such as souvenir shops, restaurants, and banks.
name: Pino Park

detail_description: The Iglesia de San Juan Bautista in Puno is a striking building in the French Ogival style. It is home to the patron saint of Puno, the Virgin of Candelaria, and hosts vibrant celebrations in February. The church's interior is a place for prayer and reflection, while outside, visitors can witness grand decorations and festivities during the annual festival. Additionally, staying at a nearby hotel provides easy access to this cultural landmark as well as natural attractions like Lake Titicaca.
name: Iglesia de San Juan Bautista - Puno, Santuario de la Virgen de la Candelaria.

detail_description: The Balcón del Conde de Lemos is a must-visit gem in Puno, perfect for capturing stunning photos with friends against its charming colonial backdrop. This balcony stands as one of the few remaining examples of traditional colonial architecture in the area, adding a rich cultural and historical significance to your visit. Located conveniently across from the Carlos Dreyer Museum, it offers not just picturesque views but also a glimpse into Puno's artistic heritage.
name: BALCON DEL CONDE DE LEMOS

excerpt: Relaxed hotel offering a breakfast buffet & Wi-Fi access, plus a low-key restaurant.
detail_description: Sol Plaza Hotel is a relaxed and well-equipped accommodation located in the heart of Puno. Situated just off central Plaza de Armas square, it offers comfortable rooms with amenities such as cable TV and free Wi-Fi. The hotel provides a low-key restaurant and complimentary breakfast for guests to enjoy. With its convenient location near popular attractions like Plaza de Armas de Puno and Central Market, this charming boutique hotel is an ideal choice for travelers looking for quality service and a pleasant stay.
name: Sol Plaza Hotel

excerpt: Polished lodging on a rocky island, offering an upscale eatery, a cocktail bar & free Wi-Fi.
detail_description: GHL Hotel Lago Titicaca is a top-notch accommodation located on the shores of Lake Titicaca, offering privileged access to activities like sailing and fishing. Whether you're traveling for leisure or business, this exclusive hotel promises a memorable experience filled with relaxation and comfort. The hotel provides not only a place to rest but also exclusive services such as a gym, gardens, meeting rooms, restaurants, bar, and room service.
name: GHL Hotel Lago Titicaca
address: Isla Esteves s/n Lago Titicaca Puno, Sesquicentenario, Puno, Peru

detail_description: Mirador El Condor, also known as Mirador de Kuntur Wasi, is a popular spot in Puno offering panoramic views of the city and partial views of Lake Titicaca. Visitors may be lucky enough to catch a glimpse of condors soaring through the skies. The site features a large Condor statue and a religious Cross monument, both accessible after climbing over 700 stairs. Despite the challenging ascent, the breathtaking views make it worth the effort.
name: Mirador El Condor

excerpt: Straightforward rooms in a down-to-earth hotel offering complimentary breakfast & Wi-Fi.
detail_description: Casa Andina Standard Puno is an excellent budget-friendly hotel located in the heart of downtown Puno. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the property offers complimentary breakfast as well as free Wi-Fi. Nearby attractions such as Pino Park and Plaza de Armas are easily accessible, making this a great choice for travelers looking for a convenient location without breaking the bank.
name: Casa Andina Standard Puno

excerpt: Informal rooms in a low-key hotel featuring lake views, casual dining & a free breakfast buffet.
detail_description: Casa Andina Premium Puno is a charming hotel located in Puno, offering informal yet cozy rooms with stunning views of Lake Titicaca. The upscale property features a gourmet restaurant, bar, and terrace where guests can enjoy the magnificent surroundings. The traditional Andean architectural style adds an understated elegance to the hotel, allowing the natural beauty of the area to take center stage.
name: Casa Andina Premium Puno

excerpt: Simply furnished rooms in an unassuming hotel offering Wi-Fi & a continental breakfast buffet.
detail_description: Hotel Kaaro in Puno offers simply furnished rooms with amenities such as Wi-Fi and a continental breakfast buffet. Guests have praised the helpful staff who facilitated early check-in and organized tours. The hotel provides comfortable rooms equipped with flat-screen TVs, private bathrooms, and free Wi-Fi. While some guests enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and clean rooms, others noted that the common areas were cold.
name: HOTEL KAARO

detail_description: La Casona Restaurant in Puno, Peru is a renowned dining establishment that offers an unforgettable gastronomic experience. The restaurant boasts a blend of upscale modern ambiance with colonial-era artwork and antiques, creating a unique and inviting atmosphere. Known for its authentic Andean cuisine, La Casona serves up flavorful soups, grilled meats, and fish dishes. Visitors can savor local specialties such as lomo de alpaca (alpaca steak) and quinoa soup.
name: La Casona Restaurant

detail_description: Pacha Mixology Coffee Molecular Bar is a unique restaurant in Puno, Peru that offers a blend of Peruvian cuisine and molecular mixology. The venue features a lively and relaxed atmosphere across multiple floors, catering to diverse clientele. It is known for its innovative take on pisco drinks, incorporating juice balls and liquid nitrogen effects. Additionally, the bar serves freshly brewed Peruvian espresso, making it an ideal destination for coffee and cocktail enthusiasts alike.
name: Pacha Mixology Coffee Molecular Bar

detail_description: La Choza de Oscar is a Peruvian restaurant located in Puno, offering a variety of Peruvian and Latin dishes, including soups and rotisserie chicken. It provides fast service, the option to make reservations, a cozy atmosphere with table service, and an exciting folkloric show. Conveniently situated near Plaza de Armas, it serves delicious and generous portions. Visitors praise its flavorful rotisserie chicken seasoned with local herbs and spices.
name: La Choza de Oscar

excerpt: Airy, modern quarters in a relaxed hotel offering complimentary Wi-Fi & a breakfast buffet.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Puno, Hotel Tierra Viva Puno Plaza offers a convenient and accessible location for guests to explore the city. The hotel boasts spacious and contemporary rooms with a sophisticated design, providing a comfortable stay for visitors. With complimentary Wi-Fi and a breakfast buffet, guests can enjoy modern amenities during their stay. Additionally, the hotel's central location provides easy access to nearby attractions such as Plaza de Armas and Carlos Dreyer Museum.
name: Hotel Tierra Viva Puno Plaza

detail_description: Kamizaraky Rock is a vibrant hotspot that buzzes with energy every day, making it the perfect destination for those looking to unwind and have fun. This lively pub offers an impressive selection of games and a diverse menu featuring delicious homemade pizzas that are simply a must-try. The bar boasts an extensive range of beers and cocktails, including standout margaritas crafted by the friendly owner, Raul, who is known for his engaging personality.
name: Kamizaraky Rock

detail_description: Puno Plaza Vea is a convenient spot for various needs, offering pantry items, electronics, prepared foods, fruits and vegetables, and even clothing. While it may not have the widest selection and its produce might be pricier compared to local markets, it's known for its consistency and quality. Located on Los Incas street near Parque Pino, this supermarket is a go-to place for both locals and tourists.
name: Puno Plaza Vea

detail_description: Puno, a city in Peru, offers a scenic train ride over the Andes with options like Peru Rail and Belmond Andean Explorer. The Puno station is located in the city center and serves as the boarding point for the PeruRail Titicaca train. The station exudes mysticism and is conveniently situated near Lake Titicaca. Passengers have praised the attentive service, cleanliness, and overall great experience when traveling from Puno to Cusco by train.
name: Puno

detail_description: Mirador Puma de Puno, located just 20 minutes from the town, offers stunning views of Lake Titicaca and the city. The lookout point is shaped like a puma and features beautiful statues, sculptures, and pools created by talented artists. The name 'Puma Uta' translates to 'the house of the Puma,' symbolizing the protector of the Andes region.
name: Mirador Puma de Puno

detail_description: Plaza del Faro, also known as the Puno Cathedral, is a notable landmark in Puno, representing the Diocese of the region. It serves as the central part of Puno's major square and houses the Bishop's throne. Adjacent to a small park close to the pier, visitors can find numerous vendors selling various souvenir items. Additionally, there is a monument dedicated to Admiral Miguel Grau, a war hero.
name: Plaza del Faro

detail_description: Positive Rock 'n Reggae is a vibrant and lively music scene found in various bars and clubs such as Cafe Bar at Casa del Corregidor, Kamizaraky Rock Pub, Pacha Mixology, La Careta, Platinum Puno, Domino Club, and Memorise. This genre of music creates an uplifting atmosphere where visitors can enjoy the fusion of rock and reggae tunes while sipping on their favorite drinks.
name: Positive Rock 'n Reggae

detail_description: Cruz del Sur is a well-known bus service that offers convenient transportation from Cusco, Arequipa, and other tourist destinations to Puno. For the latest schedules and fares, it's best to visit their official website.
name: Cruz del Sur
Óvalo Manco Cápac y Mama Ocllo

detail_description: The Uros Floating Islands, a group of around 90 artificial islands made entirely of reeds, are a must-see destination. Located on Lake Titicaca, these islands offer a unique glimpse into a completely different way of life. The inhabitants have built and maintained the islands using Totora, a type of reed native to the lake. A visit to these self-sustainable islands provides an opportunity to learn about the region's culture, traditions, and crafts.
name: Uros Floating Islands

excerpt: Ancient burial ground featuring giant cylindrical funerary towers built by a pre-Incan people.
detail_description: Sillustani, located in the Lake Titicaca region, is an ancient burial ground featuring impressive cylindrical funerary towers known as chullpas. These towers were built by a pre-Incan civilization to serve as the final resting place for nobles, housing mummies and valuable artifacts. The site offers a magical and beautiful experience with the option to explore on your own or book a tour for informative insights into its history.
name: Sillustani

detail_description: The Coca Museum & Costumes is a small and unique museum that provides fascinating information about the coca plant, including its historical, medicinal, and cultural uses. However, the presentation of the exhibits can be dull as they consist mainly of English text accompanied by photographs and old Coca-Cola ads. Nonetheless, one highlight is the collection of traditional costumes on display. Additionally, the museum features a highly detailed replica of a drug user that adds to its authenticity.
name: Coca Museum & Costumes

detail_description: Templo San Antonio is one of the ancient temples in Puno, alongside the Cathedral of the Plaza de Armas and the San Juan temple. The church houses several saints and hosts charitable activities throughout the year. Despite lacking proper signage and lighting, it remains a peaceful place for visitors. The interior features wooden pulpits and colonial-style paintings, adding to its historical charm.
name: Templo San Antonio

detail_description: The Estadio Enrique Torres Belon, situated in Puno, is the largest stadium in the area. This versatile facility can accommodate various sports events, concerts, and live performances. With a seating capacity of 20,000 people, it has the ability to host large gatherings such as political rallies and social functions. The ambiance within is remarkable and elicits a wide range of emotions during events like the Candelaria festivity. It comes highly recommended for those planning to attend this festival in February.
name: Enrique Torres Belon Stadium
